pr_title: Add the implementation of Sequencer RPCs using Protobuf

timeline.message:
Add Implementation of Sequencer RPCs using Protobuf

Provides implementation of Sequencer RPCs using Protobuf. Done as part of an effort to support rolling upgrades.

Add Implementation of Sequencer RPCs using Protobuf

Provides implementation of Sequencer RPCs using Protobuf. Done as part of an effort to support rolling upgrades.

Add Implementation of Sequencer RPCs using Protobuf

Provides implementation of Sequencer RPCs using Protobuf. Done as part of an effort to support rolling upgrades.

Add Implementation of Sequencer RPCs using Protobuf

Provides implementation of Sequencer RPCs using Protobuf. Done as part of an effort to support rolling upgrades.

timeline.bodyText: Can you add the Javadoc for this class and its API methods?
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Can you add the Javadoc for this class and its API methods?
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: This can be removed as this behaviour is already provided in AbstractServer.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: This can be removed as this behaviour is already provided in AbstractServer.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: This can be removed once the deprecated methods are removed.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Why is this value part of the factory? It seems like getMinAddress is just a constant.
timeline.author: zfrenette

replies.bodyText: It was initially present as a parameter initializer along with its declaration and I wanted it to be overridden by the test cases to initialize with a new custom value. So I kept the default behaviour in this part. I understand the FactoryHelper should always return the default objects as we will never be testing it. But I didn't see any other alternative. Can you suggest one if you have one in mind?
replies.author: chetangudisagar

replies.bodyText: Hmm. Would spying on the SequencerServer work here? There's a getter annotation for the globalLogTail, so you could inject your desired value through this getter method.
replies.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Maybe the type can be turned into a boolean: all_streams? This way the else case and the exception can be avoided.
timeline.author: zfrenette

replies.bodyText: Can be done but it may not be future proof in this use case, like, what if a new type of stream request comes up other than streams and all_streams? for example, streams meet a certain criteria/behaviour -- active_streams, inactive_streams. The chances are less but there is a possibility. So I didn't bother changing it. I thought that was one reason why it was initially an Enum instead of a boolean value.
replies.author: chetangudisagar

timeline.bodyText: nit: can you consider using a less generic name for this class?
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Can remove the public? I think these should only exposed to the package for unit tests.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Can these types be removed, along with the wire protocol objects that are no longer needed (like TokenRequest)? For the wire protocol objects that are still needed, we can still remove the implements ICorfuPayload as well as the serialization methods that are no longer needed.
timeline.author: zfrenette
timeline.diffHunk:

     // Base Messages
     ACK(4, TypeToken.of(CorfuMsg.class), true, false),

+//    STREAMS_ADDRESS_RESPONSE(27, new TypeToken<CorfuPayloadMsg<StreamsAddressResponse>>(){}),

replies.bodyText:
Done, Thank you.
Removed the following files.
- TokenRequest.java
- SequencerRecoveryMsg.java
- StreamsAddressRequest.java

Removed implements ICorfuPayload and serialization and deserialization constructors for the following files. (I couldn't remove them as they were used beyond the RPC layer.)
- TokenResponse.java
- SequencerMetrics.java
- StreamsAddressResponse.java
replies.author: chetangudisagar

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this can become a boolean so that we can just directly return the result? I think this is what's being done in the layout PR.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: The old handler methods can be removed as well.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Consider removing the 'Corfu' prefix in order to match the other tests.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Is this argument captor necessary? I think calling verify with the expected object should suffice here. In most cases, if you know the result ahead of time, you don't need an argument captor.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Should these be equal to false? That's how the message is sent in the client.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Here too. Just verify that trim was called with trimMark.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: I notice that you have some repeated initialization code, such as the initialization of the server, in a handful of tests. Would it be simpler to move such snippets here? This would also help you break the larger tests down into smaller units without having to repeat the initialization work.
timeline.author: zfrenette

replies.bodyText: Thanks for pointing it out. I was still in the middle of some changes. I will keep in mind to move the common code here.
replies.author: chetangudisagar

timeline.bodyText: Why do you have multiple factories? You have already used the spy annotation above.
timeline.author: zfrenette

replies.author: chetangudisagar

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure I understand where the exception comes from. Something like doReturn(cache).when(mockSequencerFactoryHelper).getSequencerServerCache(anyInt(), anyLong()) should work. Alternatively, maybe we can always use a mock of the factory instead of a spy?
Note: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11620103/mockito-trying-to-spy-on-method-is-calling-the-original-method provides a few possible explanations for the issue.
replies.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Why does these values differ from the ones set when the client sends the message? This seems to be the case in multiple places.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this argument captor is needed. See similar comments.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Can we consider breaking up these larger tests into smaller units, instead of testing all the data paths for an RPC in a single unit test?
timeline.author: zfrenette

replies.bodyText: They all operate on the same streamsAddressSpaceMap data on the sequencer server. The only difference between each one is the way they fetch the address space data (specific stream vs all stream). The third one is an invalid one. Hence I clubbed them. Splitting would slightly increase the time and space required for tests.
replies.author: chetangudisagar

timeline.bodyText: Can we also verify that some of the state was not updated? Methods like setSequencerEpoch and others should not have been invoked when the bootstrap request is stale.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Same here. Consider also verifying that methods like setSequencerEpoch were not called.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Please complete this java doc :)

timeline.bodyText:

timeline.bodyText: Please use standard formating here: wrap the return statement with curly brackets in new lines (as it used to be).
timeline.author: WenbinZhu

timeline.bodyText: Maybe it's better to create a new map as it was and let GC collect it instead of clearing which probably takes more time because clear() needs GC + remove.
timeline.author: WenbinZhu

timeline.bodyText: Same comment as above
timeline.author: WenbinZhu

timeline.bodyText: Could you create a variable UUID streamId = getUUID(id) at the start of the for loop？ Beucase line 715 in this loop is also calling getUUID(id), we can avoid doing extra work by creating a variable first.
timeline.author: WenbinZhu

timeline.bodyText: There is already a SequencerServerTest in test package, can you either combine them into one file or rename one of them?
timeline.author: WenbinZhu

replies.bodyText: Hmm, I thought it was Maithem's suggestion to keep this name (we originally name them like CorfuSequencerServerTest, etc). They might not be able to be combined since these two test sets have quite different setup, and we intended to replace the old ones with the new Mockito unit tests later. Maybe @zfrenette and @Maithem could add more detail on this?
replies.author: xcchang

timeline.bodyText: NIT: fix the indent here to align with other @param lines.
timeline.author: WenbinZhu

timeline.bodyText: Where are these two msg types used? Looks like these are accidently added.
timeline.author: WenbinZhu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,6 +60,8 @@
     ERROR_VALUE_ADOPTED(59,new TypeToken<CorfuPayloadMsg<ReadResponse>>() {}),

+    LAYOUT_ALREADY_BOOTSTRAP(60, TypeToken.of(CorfuMsg.class), true, false),

replies.bodyText: Yeah these two msg types were removed in the PR for Layout PRC, they might be accidentally added when solving the conflicts.
replies.author: xcchang

timeline.bodyText: Typo: linktestSequencerChangeDuringAutoCommit -> testSequencerChangeDuringAutoCommit
timeline.author: WenbinZhu

timeline.bodyText: This class inherits from ICorfuPayload so it requires this constructor, but I think with your change this class should no longer inherit from ICorfuPayload and this constructor can be removed.But I don't know why currently it's still inheriting from ICorfuPayload?
timeline.author: WenbinZhu

replies.bodyText: I tried to remove the inheritance and the testSequencerChangeDuringAutoCommit failed as stated in the javadoc. Could you share what you found about this? @chetangudisagar
replies.author: xcchang

replies.bodyText: This is also used by the LogUnitServer (i.e. LOG_ADDRESS_SPACE), so it cannot be removed until both servers are running on Protobuf.
replies.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: nit: Can we clarify this note? It seems to suggest that there is something unique about this test case, but the error occurs simply because the LogUnitServer also needs to serialize a StreamsAddressResponse. These methods can be removed once both of the servers are using Protobuf.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: CorfuMessage.ResponseMsg can just be replaced by ResponseMsg, and the corresponding import can be removed.
timeline.author: zfrenette

      */

-            .generateHandlers(MethodHandles.lookup(), this);

-        return msg.getPayload();

+    private static Object handleTokenResponse(CorfuMessage.ResponseMsg msg,

timeline.bodyText: nit: This can be simplified a little by removing the local variable.
timeline.author: zfrenette
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -37,33 +41,89 @@ public SequencerClient getClient(long epoch, UUID clusterID) {
      * The handler and handlers which implement this client.
      */
     @Getter
-    public ClientMsgHandler msgHandler = new ClientMsgHandler(this)
-            .generateHandlers(MethodHandles.lookup(), this);
-
-    /**
-     * For old CorfuMsg, use {@link #msgHandler}
-     * The handler and handlers which implement this client.
-     */
-    @Getter
     public ClientResponseHandler responseHandler = new ClientResponseHandler(this)
             .generateHandlers(MethodHandles.lookup(), this)
             .generateErrorHandlers(MethodHandles.lookup(), this);
 
-    @ClientHandler(type = CorfuMsgType.SEQUENCER_METRICS_RESPONSE)
-    private static Object handleMetricsResponse(CorfuPayloadMsg<SequencerMetrics> msg,
-                                                ChannelHandlerContext ctx, IClientRouter r) {
-        return msg.getPayload();
+    /**
+     * Handle a token response from the server.
+     *
+     * @param msg The token response message.
+     * @param ctx The context the message was sent under.
+     * @param r   A reference to the router.
+     * @return {@link TokenResponseMsg} sent back from server.
+     */
+    @ResponseHandler(type = PayloadCase.TOKEN_RESPONSE)
+    private static Object handleTokenResponse(CorfuMessage.ResponseMsg msg,
+                                              ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
+                                              IClientRouter r) {
+        TokenResponseMsg responseMsg = msg.getPayload().getTokenResponse();
+
+        return getTokenResponse(responseMsg);
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Handle a bootstrap sequencer response from the server.
+     *
+     * @param msg The bootstrap sequencer response message.
+     * @param ctx The context the message was sent under.
+     * @param r   A reference to the router.
+     * @return True if ACK, false if NACK.
+     */
+    @ResponseHandler(type = PayloadCase.BOOTSTRAP_SEQUENCER_RESPONSE)
+    private static Object handleBootstrapSequencerResponse(ResponseMsg msg,
+                                                           ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
+                                                           IClientRouter r) {
+        BootstrapSequencerResponseMsg responseMsg =
+                msg.getPayload().getBootstrapSequencerResponse();
+        return responseMsg.getIsBootstrapped();

timeline.bodyText: nit: Replace CorfuMessage.HeaderMsg by just HeaderMsg.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: I couldn't help but notice that the Protobuf representation for a StreamsAddressSpace uses an uint64 to represent the trim mark. But in some places, the value is initialized with a negative value (see, for example, LogMetadata.java::96). Can this be a problem? I have a similar concern with the representation of the tail in StreamsAddressResponseMsg in sequencer.proto.
timeline.author: zfrenette

replies.bodyText: Actually, from the test cases in SequencerServerTest, they suggest that this is not an issue.
replies.author: zfrenette

replies.bodyText: Java doesn't have unsigned longs. When the system is first bootstrap the trim mark should be less than 0. Otherwise address 0 will be incorrectly considered trimmed. Why not use int64?
replies.author: Maithem

replies.bodyText: Thanks for confirming. This change has been made.
replies.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: nit: the epoch as well.
timeline.author: zfrenette

@@ -243,19 +256,48 @@ public static StreamAddressRangeMsg getStreamAddressRangeMsg(StreamAddressRange
     }
 
     /**
-     * Returns a StreamAddressResponse object from its log tail and List

-     * represented in Protobuf.
+     * Returns a new {@link ResponsePayloadMsg} Protobuf object consisting of a
+     * {@link StreamsAddressResponseMsg} object with the logTail and addressMap set from the
+     * parameters.

timeline.bodyText: I think we can remove the implements ICorfuPayload<TxResolutionInfo> for this class, along with its serialization methods.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: nit: Protobuf
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Can this be a problem during the rolling upgrade process? We might not need to address this right away, but I can potentially see an issue if a response is received corresponding to a newer token type, if one is ever added. In several other places where a similar approach is employed, getOrDefault is used. I'm not sure if this is appropriate here, but we should keep this in mind when we discuss the capabilities exchange.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Should the ignoreEpoch and ignoreClusterId flags be set to false? This is how the client sends this request.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Two token requests were sent here. Can we confirm that removing one does not effect the integrity of the test?
timeline.author: zfrenette

replies.bodyText: Just checked that sending two requests won't change the verification logic later, so I'd prefer to keep one request since  having two identical sendRequest blocks here looks a little weird.
replies.author: xcchang

timeline.bodyText: Are these all supposed to be SequencerMetrics.READY?
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Maybe also verify that the size of the maps are the same, in case one key-set is a subset of the other.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Can we rename this, as suggested here #2836 (comment) ?
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Can we use TextFormat.shortDebugString here and in other places where we log a Protobuf message?
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Use TextFormat.shortDebugString?
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Maybe include the type received as part of the exception message?
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Maybe consider factoring some of the common preparation code here? If nothing can be cleanly factored, consider updating the comment.
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: CASE 2:
timeline.author: zfrenette

timeline.bodyText: Out of curiosity, why does this need to be mocked?
timeline.author: zfrenette

replies.bodyText: These two maps were exposed to have some verifications in the test cases, but we now use new HashMap<>() pattern in the SequencerServer and don't want to go into such details in tests, so they are deleted.
replies.author: xcchang
